snippet.title: French cinema star Jeanne Moreau dies aged 89
snippet.content:
Film Trailer: 'Chimes at Midnight' 1:47
Watch the film trailer for "Chimes at Midnight," starring Orson Welles, Jeanne Moreau and Margaret Rutherford. Photo: Janus Films
January 8th 2016 2 years ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Entertainment - syndicated/
Actress Jeanne Moreau has died at the age of 89. Picture: Supplied
APNews Corp Australia Network
Share
FRENCH actress Jeanne Moreau, whose seven-decade career included work with Francois Truffaut, Orson Welles, Wim Wenders and other acclaimed directors, has died aged 89. The French president's office announced her death in a statement Monday without providing a cause. An assistant to her agent confirmed the death but would not provide details.
French actress Jeanne Moreau attends the screening of US director Woody Allen's film 'Vicky Cristina Barcelona'. Picture: AFPSource:AFP Moreau, perhaps best known for her performance in Truffaut's 1962 "Jules and Jim," continued working well into her 80s. She won awards at the Cannes Film Festival, which she presided over twice, and an honorary Oscar. President Emmanuel Macron hailed her for her deep range, extending beyond her early roles as a femme fatale into comedy and other genres, and praised her political activism. Information about funeral arrangements and survivors was not immediately available.
French actors Jeanne Moreau and Louis Jourdan. Picture: SuppliedSource:News Corp Australia
